TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListViewItemConverter extends System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItemConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you wish to convert to.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.

abstract member ConvertTo : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj * Type -> obj override this.ConvertTo : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj * Type -> obj

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be , so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return .
An optional culture info. If not supplied the current culture is assumed.
The type to convert the object to.
Docs.summary: Converts the given object to another type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The most common types to convert are to and from a string object. The default implementation will make a call to <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string. If this cannot convert to the destination type, this will throw a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
